description:
Defines the properties for creating a new team through the MCP.
The 'id' is typically server-generated and not part of the add attributes.
title: MCP Team Add Attributes

isPrivate.description: Specifies if the team is private or public.
isPrivate.title: isPrivate

handle.description: Optional team handle. Must be unique if provided.
handle.title: handle

config.description:
Optional team configuration object.
This should be the parsed TeamConfigObject, not a stringified version.
config.title: config

memberInvites.description:
Optional list of members to invite initially.
User IDs are expected.

userId.description: User ID of the member to invite.
userId.title: userId

willBeAdmin.description: Grant admin privileges to the invited member upon joining.
willBeAdmin.title: willBeAdmin

memberInvites.title: memberInvites

TeamConfigObject.title: TeamConfigObject

__version.description: Store the version number for future compatibility
__version.title: __version

structure.description:
Declarative description of the team's organisational structure.

* **type** â€“ the standard you are using (`"MOISE+"`, `"FIPA ACL"`, `"ArchiMate"`, etc.).
  *If you are unsure, start with **MOISE+** â€“ purposeâ€‘built for multiâ€‘agent systems.*
* **version** â€“ (optional) version of the chosen spec/dialect.
* **content** â€“ raw payload (string). Could be a MOISE+ structural layer snippet, a FIPA ACL role ontology in Turtle, an ArchiMate XML export, etc.
structure.title: structure

ConfigResource.description: Resource definition for storing links and external data
ConfigResource.title: ConfigResource
